title: How to Apply Raw Milk on Your Face

steps.title: Wash your face with a gentle cleanser.
steps.content: Wash your face with a gentle cleanser. Use a face cleanser that is fragrance- and dye-free to wash away any dirt and oil on your skin. Gently pat your skin dry with a towel.

steps.title: Dab 2 tablespoons (30 mL) of raw milk onto a cotton pad.
steps.content: Dab 2 tablespoons (30 mL) of raw milk onto a cotton pad. Make sure the milk you are using says “raw” or “unpasteurized” somewhere on the container. Dab a small amount of milk onto a cotton pad and allow it to soak in. Depending on where you live, raw milk may not be legal to purchase in grocery stores since it has not been heat-treated and could contain dangerous bacteria. [2] X Trustworthy Source US Food and Drug Administration U.S. government agency responsible for promoting public health Go to source To find out where you can purchase raw milk near you, visit https://www.rawmilkinstitute.org/find-raw-milk

steps.title: Rub the cotton pad on your face for 1 minute.
steps.content: Rub the cotton pad on your face for 1 minute. Use gentle, circular motions to apply the milk to your face. Apply it to every corner of your skin, including your eyelids and up to your hairline. Try to catch any drips of milk before they run off of your face and rub them in. [3] X Research source The natural vitamins and minerals in raw milk help to lock in moisture and even out your skin tone.

steps.title: Rinse your face with cool water.
steps.content: Rinse your face with cool water. Cool water helps to close your pores and lock in the moisture that was provided by the milk. Rinse away all of the milk on your face and gently pat your skin dry with a clean towel. [4] X Research source Never rub your face with a towel. This can hurt sensitive skin and make dry patches even flakier.

steps.title: Apply the raw milk every day for best results.
steps.content: Apply the raw milk every day for best results. If you want to keep your skin moisturized and even, apply raw milk to your skin once a day as part of your normal skincare routine. You can apply it in the morning or at night, whichever you prefer. If you have oily or combination skin, raw milk may be enough of a moisturizer for you. If you have particularly dry skin, you may need to add some additional moisture to your face with lotion.

steps.title: Mix 3 tablespoons (44 mL) of milk with 1 US tbsp (15 mL) of honey.
steps.content: Mix 3 tablespoons (44 mL) of milk with 1 US tbsp (15 mL) of honey. Raw milk has lactic acid that helps to dissolve impurities in your skin, while honey moisturizes your skin and leaves it feeling soft. Combine raw milk and honey in a bowl that you can take with you to the bathroom. Try to find raw honey that has no additives in it for the best results.

steps.title: Massage the mixture into your skin for 5 minutes.
steps.content: Massage the mixture into your skin for 5 minutes. Pick up small handfuls of the milk and honey mixture and use gentle circular motions to apply it to your skin. Avoid your eyes and the delicate skin around them. Massage it into your skin for about 5 minutes total. If you have any noticeable dark spots on your face, spend more time massaging the mixture into those areas. You can also use a cotton pad to apply your mixture if you’d like to.

steps.title: Let the mixture sit on your skin for another 5 minutes.
steps.content: Let the mixture sit on your skin for another 5 minutes. Milk and honey both work to refresh and rejuvenate your skin. Let them sit on your skin for about 5 minutes so that they have time to absorb into the deeper layers of your face. You can finish the rest of your nighttime routine as you let the mixture sit.

steps.title: Rinse your skin with cold water.
steps.content: Rinse your skin with cold water. Cold water helps to lock in the moisture from the milk and honey by closing your pores. Rinse your face until the milk and honey mixture is all gone and gently pat your face dry with a towel. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Repeat this daily to remove dark spots and even out your skin tone.
steps.content: Repeat this daily to remove dark spots and even out your skin tone. Raw milk and honey are very gentle on the skin, so you can use the mixture as long as you’d like to. Keep using the milk and honey on your face until you have evened out your skin tone and removed any dark spots. [6] X Research source You may see results in about 1 month, depending on how dark your dark spots are.

steps.title: Mix 4 tbsp (36 g) of turmeric and 5 tablespoons (74 mL) of raw milk.
steps.content: Mix 4 tbsp (36 g) of turmeric and 5 tablespoons (74 mL) of raw milk. Turmeric is a spice that helps to lighten and even out your skin tone. Mix together raw milk and turmeric until they form a yellow paste. [7] X Research source You can purchase turmeric at most grocery stores in the spices section.

steps.title: Apply the mixture to your face with your fingers.
steps.content: Apply the mixture to your face with your fingers. Gently rub the turmeric and milk mixture all over your face in circular motions, avoiding your eyes completely. Make sure there is a thin layer over your entire face and neck. [8] X Research source Turmeric is also a mild exfoliant, so you may notice a slightly rough texture as you rub the mixture into your skin.

steps.title: Let the mixture sit for 25 minutes.
steps.content: Let the mixture sit for 25 minutes. The turmeric and milk will form a kind of paste that will be easy to keep on your skin. Allow it to sit for 25 minutes in order to lighten and brighten up your skin. [9] X Research source

steps.title: Rinse your skin with cold water.
steps.content: Rinse your skin with cold water. Lock in the moisturizing properties of the milk by rinsing off your face with cold water. Gently pat your face dry with a towel.

steps.title: Repeat this 3 to 4 times a week until your skin is even.
steps.content: Repeat this 3 to 4 times a week until your skin is even. Raw milk and turmeric work hand in hand to even out your skin tone and brighten up your face. Put your mixture on your skin a few times a week until your skin looks the way you would like it to. Turmeric is not a bleaching agent, so it won’t strip your skin of any natural pigmentation.
